urls.title: Raw sewage breaches in UK rivers 10 times greater than watchdog estimates
urls.description: In 2020 there were 160 breaches of Environment Agency permits to release sewage into rivers, UCL professor tells MPs

tweets.text: It‚Äôs far worse than anyone imagined. Our rivers are little more than open sewers. Raw sewage breaches in UK rivers are 10 times greater than @EnvAgency estimates https://t.co/fURw4paunH
@Melindola @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Or just incompetence.

@JamesBevanEA Agree, but the results in the report show a disturbing 'hands-off' trend of inaction, which makes the @EnvAgency look increasingly ineffective. Reasons? Impossible to believe due to improved environmental behaviour. EA funding and staff cuts? https://t.co/O1okhgcLWc

Good regulation is vital if we are to protect the environment from emerging threats, including climate change. As we publish our latest report on regulatory performance in England (#RPEG), here are my thoughts on what good regulation looks like https://t.co/kkCDRFC1mB https://t.co/dAdHULfBTk

tweets.text: @EnvAgency why so quiet? I do enjoy looking forward to your weekly Thursday updates. Is it because you‚Äôve probably had a record breaking week of complaints, yet again? Or are you doing nothing and just waiting for the 30th April while we suffocate in our homes? #stopthestink https://t.co/uOuwsHRAuT

@Feargal_Sharkey @Melindola @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Feargal why don‚Äôt you come and join our protest March against the inept and possibly complicit actions of @EnvAgency here in Newcastle Under Lyme, We have a mismanaged Landfill pumping out toxic gases to a 5 mile radius causing illness to community. Help usüôè
Latimer Water Meadow in the @RiverChess Valley, a great way to start Earth Day. Best to love it while we can as it is under threat from @HS2ltd and neglect from the @EnvAgency https://t.co/8NlmAN8C4L
